description:
Berry Head Pond
Berry Head Pond, located just 6km north of Rocky Harbour is another good short hike for some sightseeing in Gros Morne National Park. The 2km trail around the pond is mostly forested which makes it a good trail for windy days. It also winds though a small bog where Caribou can sometimes be seen grazing, and Newfoundland's provincial flower, the Pitcher plant grows in abundance.
Ryan Young
Newfoundland Editor
January 2006
directions:
from Port aux Basques ferry. Follow TCH east to Deer Lake. Take route 430, also known as the Viking Trail and follow it 6km north of Rocky Harbour  (4 Hour Drive) 
There is a regional airport located in Deer lake (1 1/2 hour drive)
title: Berry Head Pond
